items.title: Ramallah: Geography, History & Heritage
items.desc: Survey of Ramallah’s geology and archaeological periods (Neolithic→Islamic/modern), with recommendations to use modern survey & AI for protection/documentation, plus community–academic partnerships and cultural tourism.

items.title: Beginner’s AI Roadmap
items.desc: Emphasizes core AI concepts over tool-chasing; roadmap covering LLMs, search, image/video/audio generation, automation/agents, and “vibe coding” to reclaim time and solve real pain points.

items.title: Endless Conflict: Russia, the West, and Israel
items.desc: Chronology and key figures shaping global politics, focusing on the Israeli–Palestinian conflict and the war in Ukraine; touches on debates around NATO expansion, Mearsheimer’s analyses, and macro impacts.

items.title: AI Narratives: Reality & 2030 Futures
items.desc: Six narratives—progress/empowerment vs replacement/threat, digital colonialism, posthumanism, ethics, and bias/mirror—assessed with current evidence and practical notes for Arab policymakers.

items.title: Canaanite Rituals: Roots & Expressions
items.desc: Late Bronze → early Iron Age rituals tied to agrarian calendars; temple/open-air practices; influences (Egypt, Phoenicia, Moab, Israel); scholarly debates (e.g., human sacrifice) and continuities in Palestinian memory.

items.title: Palestine’s Legacy: Global Phenomena from the Holy Land
items.desc: Highlights contributions such as the earliest alphabet, grain agriculture/terracing/irrigation, trade/diplomacy hubs (e.g., Gaza, Jaffa), hospitality culture, stone architecture, herbal medicine, and resistance literature.

items.title: Palestine: Mirror of the World’s Conscience
items.desc: Scenario brief to 2030 on the disappearance of Palestine and global implications—cultural memory erosion, strained civic movements, leadership failures, and a wider loss of heritage and moral bearings.

items.title: Learning & AI: A Fundamental Shift
items.desc: From rote learning to self-directed, flexible, higher-order skills; effects of AI on memory, focus, leadership; identity & bias considerations; the rise of continuous learning and uniquely human skills.

items.title: Ancient Civilizations — Reappraising Durant
items.desc: Re-evaluates Will & Ariel Durant’s theses with post-1980 research; brings in Americas, Sub-Saharan Africa, East Asia; analyzes shared patterns (environment, trade, governance).

items.title: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation): A Practical Guide
items.desc: 2025 tools landscape—NotebookLM, Midjourney v7, GPT/Claude, Suno, ElevenLabs, Veo, Gemini, Grok, DeepSeek—what RAG is, why it helps LLM accuracy, and where to apply it.

items.title: Khazal Al-Majdi: Rethinking Narratives
items.desc: A critical discussion with historian Khazal Al-Majdi on archaeology-driven historiography, development of Judaism, debates around evidence, the decline of rational inquiry, and a call for scientific/philosophical renewal.
